ground_truth: He lies on top of Fantine, and her lips tremble. Once finished, he gets off her and saunters away, leaving her on her back. She lies motionless, her head on a pillow. Her rouged face is grim and somber. Fantine looks miserable. She breathes quickly and swallows. Her shoulders heave. She sits up. Her once clear skin is blotchy and smeared with dirt. She strokes her short cropped hair. Her cheeks streaked with tears, Fantine glances behind her. Her expression is solemn. Night in the slum. A punter to a pimp. A smartly-dressed man takes off his hat and grabs Fantine's dress. He presses himself on her. She scratches his face. He pushes her away as Javert approaches. Fantine recognizes Valjean and moves away. She turns her back to him. She breathes rapidly. He recoils as she spits in his face. Javert raises a hand to hold back one of his men. He picks her up in his arms. Javert watches them go. Javert is handed a letter. Standing outside in the snow, Javert opens the letter and reads it. He glances up and screws up the letter. He stands in front of Valjean. His brow furrowed, Valjean gets to his feet. Valjean sits back down at his desk. Javert looks puzzled, then bows curtly and takes his leave. Valjean watches him go, then leans on his desk. In church, he kneels at an altar. He packs money and papers into a case. He takes a carriage to court. They stare at him as the court usher escorts him out. At the hospital, a nurse tends to Fantine, who lies on her back. The nurse dabs her semiconscious patient's forehead with a cloth, then rises and walks out of the room. Valjean enters. An image of the nine-year-old blonde girl. The image has vanished. Fantine becomes still, and her head lulls to one side. Valjean closes her lifeless eyes. He bends forward and kisses her on the temple. Javert draws his sword. Having fended Javert off with a baton torn from the wall, Valjean is disarmed. He but turns, rushes out of the door, and dives into the river below. Javert runs out, but there's no sign of Valjean. Fantine lies at peace in the hospital bed. Cosette, young and grubby, is at the inn. She looks out enviously at children playing in the snow. Cosette glares. A pretty little girl. At the inn, Thenardier hauls himself to his feet and wanders past his subtle clientele. He gives a staggering bloke a drink. A silver-haired gent. He takes the man's reading glasses. His wife messes a soldier's jacket. She gazes at the handsome man. Outside along on a crate by a mule.

Standing outside in the rain, Javert unfolds the parcel and examines it. He looks down and crumples the parcel. He stands behind Valjean. His eyes wide, Valjean rises to his knees. Valjean leans forward onto the chair. Javert looks bewildered, then nods curtly and departs. Valjean observes him leave, then rests against his chair. In chapel, he sits at a bench. He stuffs coins and letters into a pouch. He rides a bicycle to town. They gaze at him as the town crier shows him inside. At the shelter, a doctor cares for Fantine, who is on her side. The doctor wipes her drowsy patient's cheek with a sponge, then stretches and sneaks out of the space. Valjean steps in. A portrait of the nine-year-old brunette girl. The portrait has disappeared. Fantine grows quiet, and her head tilts to one side. Valjean shuts her still eyes. He leans backward and taps her on the cheek. Javert draws his umbrella. Having distracted Javert with a cane taken from the shelf, Valjean is trapped. He then turns, sprints out of the window, and leaps into the valley below. Javert dashes out, but there's no trace of Valjean. Fantine rests content in the shelter bed. Cosette, young and tidy, is at the barn. She peers out delightedly at animals grazing on the grass. Cosette glances. A charming little boy. At the barn, Thenardier drags himself to his knees and drifts past his quiet audience. He hands a tired fellow a sandwich. A golden-haired lady. He takes the man's pocket watch. His wife wipes a baker's apron. She gazes at the cheerful woman. Outside near on a barrel by a goat.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat lounges on top of a cushion, and its whiskers quiver. Once completed, it hops off the cushion and trots away, leaving the cushion overturned. It remains still, its head on a book. Its painted fur is dull and dreary. The cushion appears forlorn. It exhales slowly and gulps. Its paws flap. It rolls over. Its once shiny fur is matted and speckled with dust. It brushes its trimmed whiskers. Its eyes marked with raindrops, the cushion peers around. Its demeanor is grave. Twilight in the alley. A merchant to a tailor. A fancily-clad raccoon removes its cap and snatches the cushion's blanket. It presses itself against the cushion. It swats its paw at the raccoon's nose. The raccoon shoves it away as Neptune nears. The cushion spots Pluto and shifts aside. It spins its ridge away from Neptune. It pants slowly. Neptune flinches as the cushion hisses in its face. Neptune lifts a wing to stop one of its flock. It scoops it up in its arms. Neptune observes them leave. Neptune receives a scroll. Standing beneath the stars, Neptune unfurls the scroll and examines it. It glances down and crumples the scroll. It stands beside Pluto. Its jaw clenched, Pluto rises. Pluto reclines back onto its chair. Neptune appears confused, then nods awkwardly and exits. Pluto tracks its departure, then leans on its chair. In the meadow, it bows at a boulder. It stuffs jewels and parchments into a sack. It rides a wagon to the meadow. They blink at it as the meadow guide leads it out. At the infirmary, a healer attends to the cushion, which is overturned. The healer pats its semi-conscious charge’s nose with a towel, then stands and slips out of the tent. Pluto enters. An image of the coral-colored kitten. The image has disappeared. The cushion becomes tranquil, and its head tilts to one side. Pluto seals its lifeless eyes. It leans down and nudges it on the paw. Neptune draws its lance. Having shielded Neptune off with a cane pulled from the hedge, Pluto is disarmed. It yet pivots, bolts out of the tent, and plunges into the pond below. Neptune dashes out, but there's no trace of Pluto. The cushion rests peacefully in the infirmary cot. Comet, young and patchy, is at the barn. It peers out longingly at critters bouncing in the drizzle. Comet scowls. A graceful young filly. At the barn, Orion pulls itself upright and strolls past its vague visitors. It hands an unsteady mare a nibble. A curly-tailed fox. It removes the mare's monocle. Its partner fiddles with a sailor's scarf. It stares at the dapper rooster. Outside along on a stump by a horse.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Fantine lies motionless after being left by a man, her face grim and tear-streaked. In the slum, another man assaults her until Javert intervenes. Fantine turns away from Valjean, spitting in his face. Javert receives a letter and confronts Valjean, who eventually kneels at an altar and then heads to court. At the hospital, a nurse tends to Fantine before Valjean arrives. Fantine, near death, becomes still, and Valjean closes her eyes with a kiss. Javert tries to apprehend Valjean, who escapes into a river. Fantine passes peacefully, while Cosette, young and shabby, watches other children play. Thenardier busies himself at the inn, interacting with patrons, while his wife flirts with another man.
